column5: Just got of the phone with my Commander I have been selected as one of the few in the Central Arctic region to sit a Course in June  MED. A-3 (Marine Emergency Duties Course) This course provides basic safety training for crewmembers on:路	Fishing vessels not more than 150 GT; 路	Small commercial vessels not more than 150 GT, including passenger vessels, with unberthed accommodation only, but not including ferries, on Home Trade IV and Minor Waters voyages. This is an 8-hour course,  done in one day. The exam is a simple 25 question multiple choice. You receive your certification upon successful completion. I.D. is required.  (CDN#s are now required by Transport Canada)  SVOP (Small Vessel Operator Proficiency Course) This is a stand-alone course addressing the particular needs for some minimum standards of training for operators of: 路	Commercial vessels, other than tugs, up to 5 Gross Tonnage operating not more than 25 miles offshore 路	Fishing vessels up to 15 Gross Tonnage or 12 meters overall length operating not more than 25 miles offshore. This is a 26 hour course and is done in 3 days from 8:30 a.m. each day. The course ends with a 40-question multiple-choice exam which if successfully completed gives you your certificate. I. D. Is required.  (CDN#s are now required by Transport Canada)  I kinda feel like a full spread peacock at the moment im excited  Peter
They picked the right person Peter. Congrat's.
That's great Peter, Congrats!!!!   When is the course so I know to keep an eye out for your report  Maureen
Way to go Brother!!!!!!!!!! Just teach them how to chuck past the gunnels
VERY cool-good on yah!  some dudes got all the luck  enjoy!  Paul  Take A Kid Fishing--Pefferlaw ON
